articles.title: Montolivo on Milan after Pisa: "These are three points that matter"
articles.summary: The Milan won 1-2 in Pisa with a late goal from Luka Modric which puts the chestnuts out of the fire for the Rossoneri who thus find their first victory with a newly promoted team this season.

articles.title: Amelia: "Milan have the mentality to be able to win the Scudetto"
articles.summary: Marco Amelia, former AC Milan goalkeeper, spoke live on Sportitalia as a guest. His words on Milan: "In my opinion this Milan can really aspire to the Scudetto.

articles.title: Athekame sees Pisa and goes wild: goal in the first leg, assist in the return
articles.summary: In the hard and difficult victory at the home of Pisa by 1-2, which came thanks to a champion's play by Luka Modric in the final, we saw for the second time as a starter Zachary Athekame, a Swiss full-back who arrived from ...

articles.title: Morata sent off as Como dropped points again ahead of Milan encounter – video
articles.summary: The former AC Milan player Alvaro Morata was sent off as Como dropped points again, losing 1-2 against Fiorentina, just days before the game against the Rossoneri.  Out of the next few games, including the one played yesterday, Como has always been described as the most difficult one for Milan. articles.title: Ceccarini: "I dream of Lewandowski for Milan. Stay on the sidelines in case the Pole opens up"
articles.summary: Niccolò Ceccarini, director of TMW, expressed himself thus in his editorial on the Milan transfer market: "First the Champions League then a summer campaign with a very specific objective: a great striker.

articles.title: It hasn't happened since that super season with Pioli: Loftus-Cheek scored two games in a row
articles.summary: Ruben Loftus-Cheek scored 2 times in a row for the second time in Serie A, after the one in January 2024 (against Udinese and Bologna in that case). Opta reports it.

articles.title: Rabiot forced to tactical foul against Parma to avoid missing Milan-Inter
articles.summary: Adrien Rabiot might have some regrets about turning a yellow card into a red last night, as he now must make a tactical foul before the derby against Inter.  In the dying minutes of Pisa-Milan, which the Rossoneri won by two goals to one, Rabiot was shown a red card after two bookings. The first […]

articles.title: Fabregas angry with Morata: "Whoever doesn't live with provocation should do another sport"
articles.summary: Como lost 1-2 at home to Fiorentina in a very nervous match that ended with Alvaro Morata being sent off in added time.

articles.title: New stadium, Milan was in Liverpool to view the Everton stadium
articles.summary: After in recent months Milan and Inter acquired the area of ​​the San Siro stadium in order to be able to start the works that will lead to the construction of the new Milanese facility in the coming months, in recent weeks the two clubs have ...

articles.title: Photos: Milan players react to Pisa win on social media – “Always a great feeling”
articles.summary: After the crucial win against Pisa last night, some of the AC Milan players sent messages to the fans through their social media accounts.  Thanks to goals from Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Luka Modric, one in each half, Milan prevailed 2-1 against Pisa. It was a crucial win in the Scudetto race as the ga

articles.title: How things have changed in a year: the Allegriano Milan dreams
articles.summary: About a year ago, Milan experienced one of the very rare peaks of enthusiasm of the last season: the January transfer window just ended with the arrival of moves announced as very important (Joao Felix, Gimenez, Walker) and victories in the championship...

articles.title: Agresti: "Milan are not as strong as Inter: they have fewer quality alternatives, some ailments among the top players, they don't give a sense of superiority. Yet they are still close"
articles.summary: Stefano Agresti, on the pages of the Gazzetta dello Sport on newsstands today, expressed himself as follows, commenting on the moment of Milan who beat Pisa 2-1 yesterday: "Allegri's Milan is not as strong as Inter, nor is it ...

articles.title: Modric is the third oldest player to score in Serie A after Costacurta and Ibrahimovic
articles.summary: Luka Modrić (40 years and 157 days) is the third oldest player to score in Serie A after Alessandro Costacurta (41 years and 25 days) and Zlatan Ibrahimović (41 years and 166 days). Opta reports it.

articles.title: GdS: Everton’s stadium one of many study visits as Milan proceed with San Siro plan
articles.summary: AC Milan recently sent a delegation to study Everton’s new home, the Hill Dickinson Stadium, as the San Siro plans are progressing according to plan.  After getting the green light from the city council for the sale of San Siro last year, Milan have since been working on the bureaucracy and paperwor

articles.title: Sabatini critical: "Milan extremely opaque, in the first half practically almost unwatchable. Three steps behind Bologna"
articles.summary: Sandro Sabatini, journalist, expressed himself as follows on the transfer market.

articles.title: Serie A, the updated ranking: Como slows down, Fiorentina breathes
articles.summary: In the first match of a crackling Saturday, Como lost at home against Fiorentina by 1-2.

articles.summary: Delegates from Milan have been in Liverpool to visit and study Everton’s new Hill Dickinson...

articles.title: Como loses against Fiorentina: Morata, sent off, will miss Milan
articles.summary: The Como falls four days before the match against Milan, the recovery of the twenty-fourth matchday of the Serie A Enilive championship which will be played on Wednesday at 8.45 pm at San Siro.

articles.title: Athekame’s crossing proving to be a weapon for Milan in season finale
articles.summary: Zachary Athekame has certainly responded to the initial criticism in recent weeks by showcasing his great crossing several times, including against Pisa last night.  Few knew who Athekame was when he arrived from Young Boys in the summer. He was just 20 at the time and didn’t exactly arrive from the

articles.title: The end of the first half is always Milan-branded: 9 goals in the final 15 minutes. More than any other in Serie A
articles.summary: Milan have scored 9 goals in the final 15 minutes of the first half this Serie A, more than any opponent in this Serie A. Opta reports.

articles.title: The banner appears in Como: "Better 1 day with Fabregas than 100 with Allegri"
articles.summary: About a month ago, Milan won in Como by 1-3 after a match that the Como team had played very well in the first half, but repeatedly crashed into a huge Mike Maignan, unbeatable between the posts.

articles.title: Milan Futuro 1-0 Breno: Sardo and Traore lead the way for Oddo’s side
articles.summary: Milan Futuro returned to winning ways against Breno this afternoon, largely thanks to the performances of Jacopo Sardo and Chaka Traore. After the defeat last time out, Massimo Oddo headed into today’s game under some pressure to turn things around, having fallen further away from the promotion play

articles.title: "+3": a cheerful Tomori on social media. Photos from Pisa and description with what matters most
articles.summary: Milan beat Pisa 1-2 thanks to Luka Modric's goal in the 85th minute, which was decisive in channeling the result after the momentary equalizer scored by Ruben Loftus-Cheek for the Rossoneri and by Loyola for the Tuscans.

articles.title: LIVE MN - Serie D, Milan Futuro-Breno (1-0): the Rossoneri return to victory!
articles.summary: MILAN FUTURO-BRENO 1-0, END OF THE MATCH. After one point in three games, Milan Futuro returns to victory and does so with full merit, or rather perhaps eliminating something.

articles.title: Vernazza: "If Allegri wanted it, he would win these matches without anxiety or worries, and the proof lies in the change of system that led to the 1-2 draw"

articles.summary: (ANSA) - ROME, FEBRUARY 14 - "Undoubtedly against Napoli and Juve they will be two important matches, they have a higher value, but in the end they are always worth 3 points.

articles.title: Watch: Allegri lets his emotions out after Modric’s crucial winner against Pisa
articles.summary: Massimiliano Allegri is known for showing his emotions in the dugout, especially at the end of games, and yesterday was no exception as Luka Modric scored the winner.  If there’s one thing that Milan fans have understood 24 games into the season, it’s that Allegri truly immerses himself in each game

articles.summary: AC Milan will be without their star midfielder Adrien Rabiot for the game against Como on Wednesday, with Ardon Jashari and Samuele Ricci both eyeing a chance from start.  It was in the dying minute of yesterday’s 2-1 win against Pisa that Rabiot got sent off. articles.title: Genoa 1-2 Milan Primavera: Early red card paves the way for the Rossoneri
articles.summary: A negative trend was thankfully reversed for Milan Primavera this afternoon, as they collected all points from their game against Genoa.  After three games without a win, including two defeats, Milan Primavera managed to get back to winning ways this afternoon. articles.title: Watch: Relive Pisa-Milan as Modric scores the winner late on – the highlights
articles.summary: It ended up being a complicated away trip to Pisa for Milan, who were rescued by their veteran Luka Modric in the dying minutes.  After taking the lead through Ruben Loftus-Cheek in the first half, it seemed like it would be a comfortable evening for Milan, especially since they dominated play befor

articles.title: Man on a mission and runs equalled: All the key stats from Pisa vs. AC Milan
articles.summary: AC Milan extended their unbeaten run to 23 games, and their winning run to to games, after scoring twice against Pisa last night.  Goals from Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Luka Modric were enough to secure all three points for the Rossoneri, but as we will get into, it wasn’t as easy as they perhaps would

articles.title: Füllkrug ‘relieved’ after missing penalty against Pisa: “Definitely had better days”
articles.summary: Niclas Füllkrug published a message for the AC Milan fans on Instagram this morning, after missing a penalty in the Rossoneri’s 2-1 win against Pisa. articles.title: Photo: Rabiot sends signal to Pisa-Milan referee with Instagram story
articles.summary: Adrien Rabiot has sent a message to the Pisa-Milan referee, and the officiating team in general, with a story on Instagram. articles.summary: Pisa manager Oscar Hljemark believes his side played a perfect game tactically against Milan, despite coming away with zero points in the end.  After the 2-2 draw in the reverse fixture, Milan headed into the game with a lust for revenge. articles.title: CorSera: ‘The dreamcatcher’ – Modric continues to keep Milan’s Scudetto dream alive
articles.summary: Luka Modric scored the winner for AC Milan against Pisa, showing once again just how important he is, and there has been no shortage of praise for him this morning.  At the age of 40, it’s simply incredible what Modric has brought to the team this season. articles.title: Why Füllkrug’s penalty wasn’t retaken despite obvious encroachment
articles.summary: Niclas Füllkrug missed a penalty for AC Milan in their 2-1 win against Pisa last night, but many have been asking why it wasn’t retaken due to obvious encroachment. articles.title: Obvious MOTM and flop: Player ratings for Pisa-Milan from Italian papers
articles.summary:
Luka Modric was named the MOTM in AC Milan’s 2-1 win against Pisa by every outlet, as you would expect, and there were no disagreements on the flop either.  Milan needed to clinch all three points to keep up with Inter in the Scudetto race, and that’s exactly what they did. However, it was far […]
